event.summary: 9/26/1993: Randal Maske firebombed the National Health Care Services Clinic in Peoria, Illinois, United States. There were no casualties, but the clinic sustained $10,000 in damages.
event.motive: To protest the practice of abortion and to sabotage abortion facilities operating in Illinois. Furthermore, Randal Maske claimed that God commanded him to commit the attack.
event.addnotes: Randal Maske did not confess to the firebombing until around nine years after the incident.
event.scite1: "Man Who Confessed to Peoria Bombing Sentenced to Prison," Associated Press, June 18, 2002.
event.scite2: "Planned Parenthood Office Firebombed," Associated Press, September 29, 1993.
event.scite3: Christopher Hewitt, "Political Violence and Terrorism in Modern America: A Chronology," Praeger Security International, 2005.
